prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Bikini:
I saw the murder at around 11 PM.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: After Mystic Elise died... I called out to Mystic Maya.
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: I thought it was my duty to protect the future Master of the Kurain Tradition.
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: So I removed the body from the Inner Temple by myself...
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: I dragged it behind me all the way across Dusky Bridge.
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Then I used the snowmobile to carry it back to Hazakura Temple and...
Person: Iris
Testimony 5
Testimony: ...I used the Shichishito to alter the way the wound looked.
Person: Iris
Testimony 6
Testimony: By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped.
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. So, the user wants to know which evidence and testimony contradict each other. They provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The answer should be in a JSON format at the end, but first I need to think through the contradictions.

Looking at the testimonies first. Testimony 6 from Iris says, "By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped." According to the evidence, specifically Evidence 7 (Weather Data), the snow was from 7 PM to around 10:50 PM. The murder happened around 11 PM, as Bikini saw the murder at that time. So if the murder was at 11 PM, the snow had already stopped by 10:50 PM. Wait, but Iris's testimony says the snow had stopped when the murder took place. Wait, no—the testimony says the snow had already stopped by the time the murder happened. Let me check the timing again.

Wait, the weather data says snow from 7 PM to 10:50 PM. Lightning was from 10 PM to 11 PM. The murder was at 11 PM according to Bikini. So the murder occurred after the snow stopped. So Iris's testimony 6 is saying that when the murder took place (11 PM), the snow had already stopped. But according to the evidence, the snow stopped around 10:50 PM. So that's correct. Wait, but maybe there's another contradiction.

Wait, no. The testimony and the weather data here actually align. The snow stopped before the murder. So maybe another testimony and evidence?

Looking at other testimonies. Testimony 3: Iris says she dragged the body across Dusky Bridge. Evidence 14 (Tracks Photo) shows tracks from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. But wait, if she dragged the body across the bridge, maybe there should be tracks there. But maybe the tracks photo shows something conflicting. Alternatively, the weather data's snow timing: if the snow stopped at 10:50 PM, then dragging the body across the bridge after that would leave tracks in the snow that had already stopped. But if the snow was still falling, tracks might get covered. Hmm, not sure. Let me check the other testimonies.

Testimony 4: Iris used the snowmobile to carry the body back. But maybe the snowmobile tracks would be visible. However, the Tracks Photo (Evidence 14) shows tracks from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. If she used the snowmobile, maybe the tracks would be different? Not sure. Alternatively, maybe the Crystal Sphere (Evidence 16) was found near Dusky Bridge, which has blood. If Iris dragged the body, maybe that's where the blood came from. But how does that contradict her testimony?

Looking at Testimony 5: Iris used the Shichishito to alter the wound. However, Evidence 9 (Victim's Staff) says the actual murder weapon was the staff with a hidden sword, while the Shichishito (Evidence 10) was the apparent murder weapon but not the actual one. So Iris's testimony about using the Shichishito to alter the wound matches with the fact that the Shichishito was not the real murder weapon. But that doesn't directly contradict unless the timing or something else conflicts.

Another angle: Testimony 6 says the snow had stopped when the murder took place. According to Bikini's statement in Evidence 7, the murder was around 11 PM. The snow stopped at 10:50 PM. So the testimony and evidence here agree. So that's not a contradiction.

Wait, wait. Wait, maybe Iris's Testimony 6 says the snow had already stopped, but the murder took place during the time when there was lightning (up to 11 PM). The lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM. So the snow stopped at 10:50 PM, and the murder was at 11 PM. So the testimony is correct. Hmm.

Wait, maybe another contradiction. Let's look at Testimony 3: "I dragged it behind me all the way across Dusky Bridge." But Evidence 14 (Tracks Photo) shows tracks from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. If she dragged the body across the bridge, wouldn't there be tracks on the bridge? But if the bridge was on fire (as per Larry's Sketch, Evidence 15), maybe the tracks were destroyed? Or perhaps the bridge was destroyed by the fire, making dragging the body across impossible. Wait, the bridge was struck by lightning at 10:45 PM, causing a fire that lasted around 30 minutes. So the bridge was on fire from 10:45 until about 11:15 PM. If Iris dragged the body across Dusky Bridge after the murder (which was at 11 PM), then the bridge would still be on fire. But how could she drag a body across a burning bridge? That seems impossible, which would contradict her testimony. So Testimony 3 (dragging the body across Dusky Bridge) would contradict the fact that the bridge was on fire at 10:45 PM, which would have made crossing impossible around 11 PM when the murder occurred.

Wait, the fire started at 10:45 PM and took 30 minutes to go out. So from 10:45 to approximately 11:15 PM, the bridge was on fire. If Iris was moving the body after the murder (which happened at 11 PM), then the bridge was still burning. So she couldn't have crossed it. Therefore, Testimony 3 (dragging the body across Dusky Bridge) would be contradicted by the Weather Data (Evidence 7) which states that the bridge was struck by lightning and caught fire at 10:45 PM, burning for 30 minutes. Therefore, at 11 PM and later, the bridge was on fire, making it impossible to cross. Therefore, Iris's Testimony 3 contradicts Evidence 7 (Weather Data) because she claims to have crossed the bridge after the murder when it was on fire.

So the correct pair would be Evidence 7 (Weather Data) and Testimony 3.

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 3}
